sentences.en: Fear intensified during the interregnum between Herbert Hoover and Franklin D.
sentences.cn: 恐惧在胡佛和罗斯福任期的中间期得到加强.

sentences.en: Hoover had called former Attorney General Ramsey Clark a jelly - fish .
sentences.cn: 胡佛曾把前任司法部长 拉姆齐·克拉克 叫做软骨头.

sentences.en: Hoover stood behind his desk, dressed in a piercing blue suit.
sentences.cn: 胡佛穿着一套令人赏心悦目的蓝色服装站在办公桌后面.

sentences.en: Hoover was building his reputation as a crime-buster.
sentences.cn: 胡佛作为罪犯克星的名头越来越响。

sentences.en: Hoover was inept at politics as he was superb administration.
sentences.cn: 胡佛精于管理而拙于政治.

sentences.en: I started with Hoover 26 years ago in sales and rose up through the ranks.
sentences.cn: 我26年前加入胡佛公司时做的是销售工作，后来级级攀升。

sentences.en: In 1929, President Herbert Hoover organized the federal Farm Board.
sentences.cn: 1929年, 赫伯特-胡佛总统组建了联邦农业委员会.

sentences.en: In the first place, Hoover was as inept at politics as he was superb at administration.
sentences.cn: 首先, 胡佛精于管理而拙于政治.

sentences.en: Kevin M. Murphy was formerly a senior fellow at Hoover Institution.
sentences.cn: 作者凯文·墨菲曾任胡佛研究所高级研究员.

sentences.en: Morning: Visit and review world top - rank university - Stanford university, and its landmark - Hoover Tower.
sentences.cn: 上午: 参观考察著名的硅谷人才摇篮—世界一流学府 — 斯坦福大学 、 斯坦福大学地标—胡佛塔等.

sentences.en: Oddly enough, Hollis and Hoover got on rather well.
sentences.cn: 奇怪得很, 霍利斯和胡佛居然相处得很好.

sentences.en: The Burgess and Maclean affair reinforced Hoover's prejudices.
sentences.cn: 伯吉斯和麦克莱恩事件更加深了胡佛的偏见.

sentences.en: They had passed over Hoover's triumphs.
sentences.cn: 他们避而不谈胡佛的成就.

sentences.en: You have to hoover anything before you can analyze it.
sentences.cn: 在你不具备分析能力之前,你只得胡乱吸收你所能学到的东西.

phrases.tran_cn: 胡佛水坝（美国最高的水坝，位于科罗拉多河下游）

trans.tran_en: to clean a floor,  carpet  etc using a  vacuum cleaner (= a machine that sucks up dirt )
